section_title: Prevention of implementation of certain proposals for single tier of local government
section_text: 1 1 After the commencement of this Act, no further relevant order may be made under section 7 of the 2007 Act (power to implement proposals for a single tier of local government for an area). 2 In this section— a  “ relevant order ” means an order implementing (with or without modifications) a proposal received by the Secretary of State before the commencement of this Act; “ the 2007 Act ” means the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007.
2 1 This Act extends to England and Wales only. 2 This Act comes into force on the day on which it is passed. 3 This Act may be cited as the Local Government Act 2010.
